newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka bank shares ease on retail sales.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka bank shares ease on retail sales.

text.p: Shares of Sri Lankan banking and finance shares eased in early Thursday trade, brokers said.
Seylan Mechant Bank fell 4.35 percent or 25 cents to 5.50 rupees, Asia Capital 2.94 percent or 25 cents to 8.25, Commercial Bank (non-voting) 2.63 percent or five rupees at 185.
"Retailers are taking the last bit of profit among these shares," said a local broker. "The sector is a retail favourite due to its relatively high level of liquidity and low prices."
Retail selling set in among Colombo stocks on Monday, after the index had risen over 25 points in the previous week.
